column1: ;Charlotte's Soft Pretzels;Vegan;Snack;"Dissolve yeast in warm water and set aside for a bout 10 minutes

column2: whole wheat flour and salt. When the yeast is ready
column3: stir it into the flour mixture. Add more white flour as needed to make a stiff dough.

column1: Turn dough out onto a well-floured work surface and knead by hand for 7 to 10 minutes
column2: until the dough is smooth and elastic. Form a ball.

column1: Grease a bowl with olive oil. Place dough ball in the bowl and turn right side up to coat the entire ball in oil. Place a towel over the bowl and set bowl aside
column2: preferably in a warm spot in the kitchen. Let the dough rise for about an hour and a half

column1: Preheat oven to 475°F and grease two cookie sheets.
Divide dough into 8 equal portions. Roll each portion into a rope
column2: about 20 inches long and then twist into a pretzel shape. Lightly press the ends of the rope into the pretzel.

column1: Bring water to a boil in a pot and dissolve the baking soda. Drop in pretzels one or two at a time and boil for about a minute. Drain and transfer to a baking sheet.

Sprinkle pretzels with salt. (You can also sprinkle them for cinnamon and sugar in lieu of salt.) Bake for 12 minutes or until golden brown. Remove from the oven and cool on a rack.";2 1/4 teaspoons active dry yeast. 1 1/4 cups warm water (100° to 105° F). 2 to 3 cups white flour. 1 cup whole wheat flour. 2 teaspoons coarse salt plus more for sprinkling. olive oil. 2 tablespoons baking soda.;zero-waste chef;
;Sourdough Discard Vegan Chocolate Cake;Vegan;Dessert;"Preheat oven to 350°F. Generously grease an 8-inch by 8-inch glass or metal baking pan. Combine flour
column4: baking soda and salt in a medium bowl. Combine unfed discarded starter
column7: vanilla extract and olive oil in a separate small bowl. Add wet ingredients to dry ingredients. Stir until moistened and pour batter into prepared pan. Bake for 25 to 30 minutes or until a fork inserted in the center of the cake comes out clean. Cool the pan on a baking rack. If frosting the cake
column8: allow it to cool completely first.

column1: This cake tastes delicious with ? of chocolate chips or so added it. Mix them in with the dry ingredients. If you add chocolate chips
column2: reduce the sugar by about ? cup.

column1: You can also make cupcakes. Divide batter among only 9 muffin cups of a standard
column2: 12-muffin-size pan. Bake for 15 minutes or until a fork inserted in the center of a cupcake comes out clean.

column1: All of my sourdough recipes use a 100 percent hydration sourdough starter
column2: meaning the starter contains equal parts water and flour by weight (not volume).

column1: If you don’t keep a sourdough starter
column2: increase the flour to 1½ cups and the water to 1 cup.";1 cup all-purpose flour. 1 cup packed brown sugar. ? cup cocoa powder. 1 teaspoon baking soda. ½ teaspoon salt. ½ cup unfed discarded starter straight from the refrigerator. ½ cup cold water. 1 tablespoon vinegar white
column4: or strong homemade. 2 teaspoons vanilla extract. ? cup olive oil plus more for greasing the pan. 1 portion coconut buttercream frosting if desired.;zero-waste chef;

column1: ;Tom Hunt’s Pumpkin Doughnut Muffins Recipe;Other;Breakfast;"Preheat the oven 180C
Place the pumpkin in a small pan and cover with water. Bring to the boil and simmer for 10-15 minutes until soft. Drain the liquid and keep to one side.
Put the pumpkin in a blender and blend to a puree
column2: if it sticks add a little of the cooking liquid. Put to one side and discard any leftover liquid.

column1: Beat the butter and sugar for a few minutes until light and fluffy. Add the rest of the ingredients including the pureed pumpkin and stir together until thoroughly mixed.
Fill the muffin cups almost to the top then bake for 20-25 minutes until springy.
When the muffins are still warm but cool enough to handle roll in sugar mixed with cinnamon.";200g pumpkin
column3: plus extra for the topping. 75g natural cane sugar
column4: plus extra for the topping. 1 large eggs. 180g flour. 1.5 tsp baking powder. 1/4 tsp baking soda. 1/2 tsp allspice (optional). 40ml yoghurt. 1 tsp cinnamon plus extra for topping.;pebble;

column2: Pea And Horseradish Dip Recipe;Vegetarian;Snack;Boil a kettle. Remove the broad beans from their pods. Slice the runner beans into chunks of a similar size to the broad beans. Cook the beans for 3 minutes in boiling
column3: salted water. Add the frozen peas and cook for a further 2 mins. Drain the beans and peas with a colander and then plunge them into ice water to stop the cooking process and preserve their vibrant green colour. If you don't have any ice
column4: just run the greens under the cold tap until they're cool to touch. Add the beans to a food processor with the horseradish and a drizzle of rapeseed oil and salt and pepper. Blitz until smooth. Serve the dip with your favourite crisps
column5: breads or veggies.;Broad beans. Green beans. Frozen peas. 1 teaspoon horseradish. Rapeseed oil. Salt & pepper.;pebble;

column2: Seeds And Carrot Hummus Recipe;Vegetarian;Snack;Detach the stalks from the broccoli. Remove any rough edges or knobbly bits using a knife. Cut the stalks into discs about 1 cm wide. Place the discs on a lightly oiled baking tray
column3: brush with oil and season. Pop the tray into the oven at 175 degrees for about 15 to 20 minutes. When the stalks are ready they are tender yet firm. Place the discs on a tea towel (to remove any moisture)
column4: allow them to cool and then plate them on a wooden platter. Add a dollop of carrot hummus to each one. Crumble the feta and add a few crumbs to each. Garnish with mixed seeds. To make the carrot hummus...leave the skins on and chop carrots into small
column5: rough chunks and put them all (including the ends - no waste!) in a large pan with salted water and bring to the boil. Boil until the carrots are soft. Cool them slightly and add to the food processor with the rest of the hummus ingredients and blend. Taste and season accordingly.;"3 broccoli stalks.

column6: in brine and chill for 4 hours. Using tongs

column13: for 10 minutes or until onion has softened. Remove from heat and combine with remaining ingredients. Set aside for 30 minutes to cool slightly. Preheat oven to 200°C and grease a roasting pan. Fill chicken cavity with cooled stuffing and tie legs together with kitchen string. Place chicken
column15: in prepared pan and rub with oil. Roast for 1 hour 20 minutes or until the juices run clear when the thickest part of a thigh is pierced with a skewer. Remove from oven and rest for 10 minutes. For the salad

column18: for 6 minutes or until golden. Remove with a slotted spoon and drain on paper towel. To make the dressing

column21: then drizzle with a little dressing.;"140g salt flakes.

;Raw choc-strawberry bars;Vegetarian;Dessert;Soak cashews in a bowl of water overnight. The next day
column2: drain cashews. Grease a 20cm x 30cm lamington pan and line with baking paper
column3: allowing 5cm to overhang. For the chocolate layer
column4: whiz all ingredients and 1/3 cup (80ml) water in a food processor until finely chopped. Press half the mixture into the prepared pan and smooth the surface. Chill until needed. Place remaining mixture between 2 sheets of baking paper and roll out to a 20 x 30cm rectangle. Chill until needed. Wipe clean food processor. Add cashews and whiz for 2-3 minutes or until a smooth paste. Add oil
column7: and strawberries. Whiz until smooth. Pour over base and smooth the surface. Freeze for 30 minutes or until firm. Lightly brush strawberry layer with water. Cover with remaining chocolate layer
column8: pressing to join. Chill overnight or until firm. The next day
column9: remove from fridge and cut into bars. Store chilled
column11: for up to 2 weeks.;"450g raw unsalted cashews.

column3: place butter and sugar in a saucepan over medium heat. Cook
column5: until melted and smooth. Stir in cocoa
column6: transfer to a bowl and whisk for 1 minute to cool slightly. Whisk in vanilla
column8: then whisk in flour. Fold through fruit and chocolate. Transfer to prepared pan and bake for 25 minutes or until firm. Set aside. In the last 10 minutes of baking
column10: place reserved eggwhites and a pinch of salt in a stand mixer fitted with the whisk attachment and whisk to stiff peaks. Combine sugar

column14: for 4 minutes or until syrup reaches 128°C on a sugar thermometer. With the mixer on low

column16: steady stream. Increase speed to high

column18: then spread over brownie. Stand for 2 hours or until completely cool. Remove from pan
column19: discard baking paper and place on a flameproof tray. Caramelise top of nougat with a kitchen blowtorch. Using a sharp knife dipped in hot water
